definition: to prostrate oneself/to fall on one's knees/to grovel
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: The city's in surrender and they're falling at your feet.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市的败者，他们拜倒在你的石榴裙下。

sentences.english: Finally they say hi and you practically drop to your knees with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 他们对你打招呼让后你终于兴奋得拜倒在他们脚下。

sentences.english: Before this ancient image penitent emperors now prostrate themselves in awe.
sentences.chinese: 悔悟的皇帝如今敬畏地拜倒在这尊古圣像面前。

sentences.english: Dick was so crazy about Jane that he threw himself at her feet.
sentences.chinese: 迪克实在是爱简，他完全拜倒在她的石榴裙下。

sentences.english: Superstar Mahi Arora has the world at her feet for a bit.
sentences.chinese: 超级巨星玛西曾让世界拜倒在她的脚下。

sentences.english: She had them eating out of her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她让他们拜倒在她的裙下。

sentences.english: The slaves prost rated themselves at their master's feet.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶们拜倒在主子的脚下。

sentences.english: As a famous actor, he makes many girl fans worship the ground he walks on.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名演员，他令许多女影迷拜倒在他脚下。

sentences.english: Hefalls head over heels for a this woman.
sentences.chinese: 他拜倒在这位女子的石榴裙下。

sentences.english: A few men succumbed to her charm.
sentences.chinese: 有些人拜倒在她的石榴裙下。

sentences.english: With her charm and beauty, she sweeps him off his feet.
sentences.chinese: 由于她的魅力和美丽，使他拜倒在她的石榴裙下。

sentences.english: They prostrated themselves before the king.
sentences.chinese: 他们拜倒在国王的脚下。

sentences.english: It seems that Kathy has had him entirely at her feet.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜好像使他完全拜倒在她的石榴裙下。

definition: to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel/to go down on one's knees
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to prostrate oneself in admiration (idiom); to adulate sb
